definition: not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
real/true/honest/really/solid/fruit/seed/definitely

sentences.english: Overlooking this piece of place, let a person feel there is worthy of the fairy tale world.
sentences.chinese: 俯视这片地方，让人感觉那里是名副其实的童话世界。

sentences.english: It is a toll to ride instead of walk, worthy of the name of 'one car for multipurpose'.
sentences.chinese: 是名副其实的一车多用，还可达到代步的目的。

sentences.english: Right now , it become a veritable garden school. It was surrounded with trees , tidy and pretty.
sentences.chinese: 如今的五一小学已成为一所名副其实的花园式学校。

sentences.english: We found ourselves in the midst of a veritable fairyland.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现我们在名副其实的仙境中。

sentences.english: This is a narrow view of be worthy of the name.
sentences.chinese: 这是名副其实的一孔之见。

sentences.english: They had to compare with English authors whose quality was as high as their reputation .
sentences.chinese: 他们一定得与英国名副其实的优秀作家比个高低。

sentences.english: He is the only poet in this country that deserves the name.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个国家唯一的一位名副其实的诗人。

sentences.english: Mongolia really is the land of opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古是名副其实的机会之地。

sentences.english: She’s a real professional and a knife expert.
sentences.chinese: 她可是一位名副其实的雕刻大师和刀工专家。

sentences.english: This place is called Chernobyl-2 not for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 这地方被称为“第二个切诺贝利”是绝对名副其实的。

sentences.english: Germany's custom Germen , there is a kind of qualified reputation which pays attention to efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 德国风俗德国人，有一种名副其实的讲究效率的声誉。

sentences.english: It really is a gold section of Chang'an District.
sentences.chinese: 是长安区名副其实的黄金地段。

sentences.english: English authors whose quality was as high as their reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他们一定得与英国名副其实的优秀作家比个高低。

sentences.english: The first true piece of sports equipment that man invented was the ball.
sentences.chinese: 人类发明的第一样名副其实的运动器材是球。

sentences.english: This is my nightly reminder of how dogs earned the moniker Man's Best Friend.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔夜夜提醒着我，狗名副其实是人类最好的朋友。
一些朋友就是名副其实的友敌。

definition: to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
just like/solemn/dignified/neatly laid out
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
can be rated as/can be said to be
a hundred percent/to the letter/out-and-out
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life
to have an undeserved reputation (idiom)
to become/to turn into
(neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
name/term of address/title
resounding/loud/well known/famous
to be worthy of/to deserve to be called/to prove oneself to be
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
pronoun/synonym/byword
genuine goods at fair prices/(fig.) genuine/real/true
